meanings.definition: A person or animal that humps or thrusts repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: The energetic puppy was one of the humpers in the park.
meanings.sent2: The humpers in the herd were mating during the breeding season.
meanings.sent3: The humpers at the zoo always attract a lot of attention.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed against the shore like relentless humpers.
meanings.sent5: The machine at the gym simulates the movements of humpers for exercise.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used for lifting or moving heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The workers used the humpers to lift the heavy boxes onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse had various humpers to assist in moving the cargo.
meanings.sent3: The humpers in the factory made the job much easier for the workers.
meanings.sent4: The crane functioned like a giant humpers, effortlessly lifting containers.
meanings.sent5: The forklift served as a reliable humpers for transporting goods around the warehouse.

meanings.definition: A slang term for someone who engages in sexual intercourse frequently.
meanings.sent1: The gossip spread that she was a notorious humpers in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: He was known as one of the humpers among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a character who joked about being a humpers.
meanings.sent4: In the dating scene, some people are just professional humpers.
meanings.sent5: The romance novel portrayed the protagonist as a charming humpers.
